titlestmt.titleproper: Pease, Arthur Stanley, 1881-1964. Arthur Stanley Pease correspondence and compositions, 1870-1963 (MS Am 1804): Guide.

titlepage.titleproper: Pease, Arthur Stanley, 1881-1964. Arthur Stanley Pease correspondence and compositions, 1870-1963: Guide.
titlepage.author: Houghton Library, Harvard College Library
titlepage.p: Â© 2003 The President and Fellows of Harvard College

did.repository: Houghton Library, Harvard College Library, Harvard University
did.unittitle: Arthur Stanley Pease correspondence and compositions,
did.abstract: Contains correspondence and writings of classics professor and Amherst College president Arthur Stanley Pease.

acqinfo.p: 67M-159. Gift of Arthur Stanley Pease; received: 1964.

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on physical access to this material. Collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation for Publication:
prefercite.p: Arthur Stanley Pease Correspondence and Compositions, 1870-1963 (MS Am 1804). Houghton Library, Harvard University.

bioghist.p: Arthur Stanley Pease (1881-1964) was a classics professor at the University of Illinois, Amherst, and Harvard. From 1927 to 1932 he was president of Amherst College. He was also an amateur botanist.

arrangement.p:
Organized into the following series:
I. Letters to Arthur Stanley Pease
II. Letters from Arthur Stanley Pease.
III. Other letters
IV. Compositions

scopecontent.p: Chiefly letters to Pease from many correspondents together with some drafts and carbon copies of outgoing letters, some family correspondence, and letters of others, and miscellaneous writings by Pease and others. Correspondence reflects Pease's research interests in the classics, professional activities (including the American Philological Association), and botanical interests.

did.unittitle: I. Letters to Arthur Stanley Pease

note.p: Letters from various correspondents to Arthur Stanley Pease.
